meanings.definition: Accept that (something) is true or exists.
meanings.sent1: She believed the story her friend told her.
meanings.sent2: I believed in Santa Claus when I was a child.
meanings.sent3: He believed the fish was talking to him.
meanings.sent4: The old man believed the mirror reflected his soul.
meanings.sent5: The detective believed the suspect's alibi was a lie.

meanings.definition: Have faith or confidence in (something or someone).
meanings.sent1: The team believed they could win the game.
meanings.sent2: She believed in her ability to succeed.
meanings.sent3: He believed his lucky socks would help him pass the test.
meanings.sent4: The child believed in the magic of her favorite toy.
meanings.sent5: The hiker believed the trail would lead him to safety.

meanings.sent1: Many people believed the legend of the haunted house.
meanings.sent2: She believed the painting was an original masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: He believed his cat could understand him.
meanings.sent4: The explorer believed the treasure map was authentic.
meanings.sent5: The scientist believed the theory was groundbreaking.
